Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of decision, reasonable apprehension of bias
Credibility_Assessment: Inconsistencies in applicant's statements, limited English proficiency
Evidence_Type: Oral testimony, lack of wedding photos, behavioral observations
Legal_Provision: Section 117(9)(d) of IRPA regarding genuineness of marriage
Basis_of_Claim: Doubt about authenticity of marital relationship
Evaluation_Standard: Reasonable apprehension of bias, reasonableness of decision
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Cumulative inconsistencies, lack of corroborating evidence
Review_Outcome: No certification of questions, dismissal of application
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA s. 117(9)(d), principles of procedural fairness
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of documentary evidence (e.g., wedding photos), inconsistent statements
Procedural_Fairness: Alleged hostile behavior by member, assessed and rejected
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Unreasonable decision, reasonable apprehension of bias
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Immigration and Refugee Protection Regulations
